messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level A2

Text saved: Asteroids are big rocks that fly in space. Now NASA is looking for smaller asteroids. These asteroids are 140 metres wide or more. NASA thinks there are about 25,000 asteroids of this size. So far, they found about 8,000. This means there are still 17,000 to find. These asteroids are a big danger. In 2013, a small asteroid exploded over a city in Russia. It was only 19 metres wide, but it hurt 1,200 people. So, these bigger asteroids are a very serious problem if they come near Earth.

metadata.feedback_text: FAILED. The text violates the 'No Excuses' vocabulary rule. The word 'exploded' is B1 level. Its presence is an immediate failure, regardless of context. While the replacement of 'injured' (B1) with 'hurt' (A2) was correct, this does not compensate for the new B1 vocabulary introduced. The text must exclusively use A2 vocabulary.

messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level A2

Text saved: Asteroids are big rocks that fly in space. Now NASA is looking for smaller asteroids. These asteroids are 140 metres wide or more. NASA thinks there are about 25,000 asteroids of this size. So far, they found about 8,000. They still need to find 17,000. These asteroids are a big danger. In 2013, a small asteroid broke into many pieces over a city in Russia. It was only 19 metres wide, but it hurt 1,200 people. So, these bigger asteroids are a very serious danger if they come near Earth.

metadata.feedback_text: PASS. This text is a flawless example of A2 writing. The vocabulary is strictly A1/A2. Complex concepts like 'exploded' and 'enter Earth's orbit' are perfectly simplified to 'broke into many pieces' and 'come near Earth'. The keyword 'asteroids' is defined immediately. Sentence structure is simple and clear. No errors found.
